fast3d.util

Class ColorGen

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.util.ColorGen

  • public abstract class ColorGen
extends java.lang.Object
    a color generator has some constant color values and functionality to create various color easily
    Author:
    Tim Trense

      gets an int where:
      bits-indices color-component
      32-24 alpha
      23-16 red
      15-08 green
      08-00 blue
      static Color from255RGB(double r, double g, double b)
      converts a color with rgb-range 0 to 255 (like in the awt-color-model) to one of the range 0 to 1
      static Color from255RGB(int rgb)
      converts a rgb-color-integer (like in the awt-color-model) to a color
      static Color from255RGBA(double r, double g, double b, double a)
      converts a color with rgba-range 0 to 255 (like in the awt-color-model) to one of the range 0 to 1
      static Color from255RGBA(int rgba)
      converts a rgba-color-integer (like in the awt-color-model) to a color
      static Color fromAWTColor(java.awt.Color c)
      a wrapper to from255RGBA()
      static Color fromAWTColorWithoutAlpha(java.awt.Color c)
      a wrapper to from255RGB()
      static Color fromHSB(double h, double s, double b)
      a wrapper to the awtColor-method getHSBColor
      all arguments within the range of [0d,1d]
      static Color fromVector(Vector3d vec)
      just copies the xyz-values to rgb, if the are in range of 0d to 1d
      if they are out of range they are constraint: all values over 1 are set to 1, all values under 0 are set to 0
      static Color fromVector(Vector4d vec)
      just copies the xyza-values to rgba, if the are in range of 0d to 1d
      if they are out of range they are constraint: all values over 1 are set to 1, all values under 0 are set to 0
      static Color genLinear(double wl)
      a not scientific way to convert a value between 0 and 1 to a color, where 0 means red, 0.5 means green and 1 means blue
      static Color genPhysically(double wavelength)
      a scientifically nearly correct way to convert the wavelength of light to a rgb-color in the visible spectrum
      a value of 380 will be ultra-violet
      a value of 780 will be infra-red
      static Color genRealistic(double wl)
      a wrapper to genPhysically() but with a mathematical range of values
      a value of 1 will be ultra-violet
      a value of 0 will be infra-red
      so with look to genPhysically() the range of values is flipped

      • genLinear

        public static Color genLinear(double wl)
        a not scientific way to convert a value between 0 and 1 to a color, where 0 means red, 0.5 means green and 1 means blue
        Parameters:
        wl - a value between 0d and 1d
        Returns:
        the corresponding color

      • genRealistic

        public static Color genRealistic(double wl)
        a wrapper to genPhysically() but with a mathematical range of values
        a value of 1 will be ultra-violet
        a value of 0 will be infra-red
        so with look to genPhysically() the range of values is flipped
        Parameters:
        wl - the lights wavelength but between 0d and 1d
        Returns:
        the corresponding color
        See Also:
        genPhysically(double)

      • genPhysically

        public static Color genPhysically(double wavelength)
        a scientifically nearly correct way to convert the wavelength of light to a rgb-color in the visible spectrum
        a value of 380 will be ultra-violet
        a value of 780 will be infra-red
        Parameters:
        wavelength - the lights wavelength in nanometers (visible between 380 and 780)
        Returns:
        the corresponding color

      • from255RGB

        public static Color from255RGB(double r,
                               double g,
                               double b)
        converts a color with rgb-range 0 to 255 (like in the awt-color-model) to one of the range 0 to 1
        Parameters:
        r - the red part
        g - the green part
        b - the blue part
        Returns:
        the corresponding color

      • from255ARGB

        public static Color from255ARGB(int argb)
        gets an int where:
        bits-indices color-component
        32-24 alpha
        23-16 red
        15-08 green
        08-00 blue
        Parameters:
        argb - the ARGB-components of the color
        Returns:
        the corresponding color

      • from255RGBA

        public static Color from255RGBA(double r,
                                double g,
                                double b,
                                double a)
        converts a color with rgba-range 0 to 255 (like in the awt-color-model) to one of the range 0 to 1
        Parameters:
        r - the red part
        g - the green part
        b - the blue part
        a - the alpha component
        Returns:
        the corresponding color

        Returns:
        the corresponding color

      • fromAWTColorWithoutAlpha

        Returns:
        the corresponding color

      • fromVector

        public static Color fromVector(Vector3d vec)
        just copies the xyz-values to rgb, if the are in range of 0d to 1d
        if they are out of range they are constraint: all values over 1 are set to 1, all values under 0 are set to 0
        Parameters:
        vec - the xyz coordinates as rgb-parts
        Returns:
        the corresponding color

      • fromVector

        public static Color fromVector(Vector4d vec)
        just copies the xyza-values to rgba, if the are in range of 0d to 1d
        if they are out of range they are constraint: all values over 1 are set to 1, all values under 0 are set to 0
        Parameters:
        vec - the xyza coordinates as rgba-parts
        Returns:
        the corresponding color

      • fromHSB

        public static Color fromHSB(double h,
                            double s,
                            double b)
        a wrapper to the awtColor-method getHSBColor
        all arguments within the range of [0d,1d]
        Parameters:
        h - the hue components
        s - the saturation of the color
        b - the brightness of the color
        Returns:
        the corresponding color

      • random

        public static Color random()
        Returns:
        a random opaque color

      • randomOpacity

        public static Color randomOpacity(double opacity)
        Parameters:
        opacity - the opacity value of the returned color
        Returns:
        a random color with the given opacity

      • randomOpacity

        public static Color randomOpacity()
        Returns:
        a random color with random opacity

      • randomPhysicallyWavelength

        public static double randomPhysicallyWavelength()
        Returns:
        a random physically nearly correct color-wavelength which can be used by genPhysically() in the visible spectrum

      • randomPhysically

        public static Color randomPhysically()
        Returns:
        a random physically nearly correct color in the visible spectrum

      • from255RGBA

        public static Color from255RGBA(int rgba)

        Parameters:
        rgba - the rgba integer given by awtColor.getRGB()
        Returns:
        the corresponding color

        Returns:
